alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey and southeast New York, including the following counties, in northeast New Jersey, western Essex and western Passaic. In southeast New York, southern Orange. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, capable of causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1/2 and 3/4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1/2 inches are expected. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Wayne, West Milford, Ringwood, Pompton Lakes, Caldwell, Bloomingdale, Fairfield, Greenwood Lake, Wanaque, West Caldwell, North Caldwell, Roseland and Tuxedo Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
